lead_paragraph: Euthanasia rates dropped 36 percent for dogs and 25 percent for cats in 2015 as adoptions climbed 17 percent, according to statistics from the agency that runs New York’s three animal shelters.

headline.print_headline: Adoptions Up as Deaths Fall at Shelters for Animals
headline.main: Animal Deaths Down and Adoptions Up Amid Reforms at New York Shelters

snippet: Euthanasia rates dropped 36 percent for dogs and 25 percent for cats in 2015 as adoptions climbed 17 percent, according to statistics from the agency that runs New York’s three animal shelters.
abstract: Animal Care Centers of NYC, which runs New York City's three animal shelters, say it is about to release report showing its euthanasia rates dropped by 36 percent in 2015 for dogs and 25 percent for cats; agency says adoptions rose by 17 percent in year, uptick attributed to improvements to number of adoption programs implemented in 2014.
